sen.j: 勘定所(かんじょうしょ)は、江戸幕府や諸藩・旗本などにおいて、財政や民政を担当する役所・支配機構の名称。
sen.e: Kanjosho is the name of an office or a governing organization established for finance and civil administration in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), in each domain and at each hatamoto (direct retainers of the Edo bakufu).

Kanjosho is the name of an office or a governing organization established for finance and civil administration in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), in each domain and at each hatamoto (direct retainers of the Edo bakufu).

Kanjosho is the name of an office or a governing organization established for finance and civil administration in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), in each domain and at each hatamoto (direct retainers of the Edo bakufu).

sen.j: 勘定奉行を長官とする場合が多い。
sen.e: It is often headed by kanjo bugyo (commissioner of finance).
It is often headed by kanjo bugyo (commissioner of finance).
It is often headed by kanjo bugyo (commissioner of finance).

sen.j: 職掌・組織・設置年代などはそれぞれ異なる。
sen.e: Each bugyosho had different official duties, organization and year of foundation.
Each bugyosho had different official duties, organization and year of foundation.
Each bugyosho had different official duties, organization and year of foundation.
Its general duties are:
Its general duties are:
Its general duties are:

sen.j: 蔵入地（直轄領）の農政を司る代官系統の職務
sen.e: Those by the local governor, who administrates agricultural policies of the directly controlled area (direct control territory)
Those by the local governor, who administrates agricultural policies of the directly controlled area.
sen.cmt: 英文では意味が重複するので文末のカッコを削除しました。
sen.e: Those by the local governor, who administrates agricultural policies of the directly controlled area.
-Collection of land taxes called nengu, etc.
-Collection of land taxes called nengu, etc.
-Collection of land taxes called nengu, etc.

sen.j: 蔵入地と知行地にまたがる業務を担当する郡奉行系統の職務
sen.e: Those by the magistrate of the district, who is in charge of the operations covering the direct controlled area and the parts given as salaries
sen.cmt: 「江戸時代に将軍あるいは大名が家臣に対して禄として与える知行」
sen.e: Those by the magistrate of the district, who is in charge of the operations covering the directly controlled area and the territory given by the shogun or feudal lord as salaries.
sen.cmt: 知行地の訳を追加しました。
sen.e: Those by the magistrate of the district, who is in charge of the operations covering the directly controlled area and the territory given by the shogun or feudal lord as salaries.

sen.j: -触の伝達・治安・治水・用水・新田開発など
sen.e: -Transmission of bakufu orders, law and order, flood control, development of new fields, etc.
-Transmission of bakufu orders, law and order, flood control, development of new fields, etc.
-Transmission of bakufu orders, law and order, flood control, development of new fields, etc.

sen.j: に大別することができる。
sen.e: As stated above, they are roughly classified into two.
As stated above, they are roughly classified into two.
As stated above, they are roughly classified into two.

sen.j: 江戸幕府の場合は両系統が勘定所に包摂されているが、別機構になっている諸藩も多い。
sen.e: In the Edo bakufu, the two types of operations are integrated into the kanjosho, but many of the domains have two independent organizations.
In the Edo bakufu, the two types of operations are integrated into the kanjosho, but many of the domains have two independent organizations.
In the Edo bakufu, the two types of operations are integrated into the kanjosho, but many of the domains have two independent organizations.

sen.j: 勘定奉行を長官として、勘定吟味役・勘定組頭・勘定・支配勘定などで構成されていた。
sen.e: Headed by kanjo bugyo, the kanjosho was composed of auditors, chief financial officers, financial officers and deputy financial officers.
sen.cmt: 「勘定奉行（かんじょうぶぎょう）は江戸幕府の職名の一つ｡勘定方の最高責任者で財政や天領支配などを司り、定員は約4人」「勘定吟味役は、江戸幕府において、勘定所の職務すべてを監査を担当した役職」「支配勘定のみ調べましたが分かりませでした。推測で訳をつけてあります。ちなみに勘定250名に対して支配勘定は90名が定員です」
sen.e: Headed by kanjo bugyo, the kanjosho was composed of auditors, chief financial officers, accountants and managing accountants.
sen.cmt: 訳語は以下を参照しました。http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=4_cjxYThNl0C&pg=PA161&lpg=PA161&dq=%22shihai+kanjo%22&source=bl&ots=S9qMEAoe1B&sig=Ze8N5BEwjWm8odqcs0JxY-qg190&hl=ja&ei=9d19TITONYGycaLvgccJ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CBUQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=%22shihai%20kanjo%22&f=false
sen.e: Headed by kanjo bugyo, the kanjosho was composed of auditors, chief financial officers, accountants and managing accountants.

sen.j: 役所は、城内の「御殿勘定所」と大手門内の「下勘定所」のふたつがあった。
sen.e: There were two offices: "Goten kanjosho" in the Edo Castle and "Shimo kanjosho" in the Ote-mon Gate.
There were two offices: "Goten kanjosho" in the Edo Castle and "Shimo kanjosho" in the Ote-mon Gate.
There were two offices: "Goten kanjosho" in the Edo Castle and "Shimo kanjosho" in the Ote-mon Gate.

sen.j: 天和 (日本)年間以降に郡代・代官の吏僚化が図られ、勘定奉行から代官に至る支配機構の整備が進められた。
sen.e: In the Tenna era and thereafter, regional magistrates and local governors were bureaucratized, and the governing system integrating commissioners of finance to local governors was developed.
sen.cmt: 「郡代：幕府では、比較的広域の幕府領を支配する代官のことをいう。江戸時代初期には関東郡代のほかに上方、尼崎、三河、丹波、河内などほぼ1国単位に郡代が置かれた」の内容から用語集を参考にregional magistratesとしました。
sen.e: In the Tenna era and thereafter, regional magistrates and local governors were bureaucratized, and the governing system integrating commissioners of finance to local governors was developed.
In the Tenna era and thereafter, regional magistrates and local governors were bureaucratized, and the governing system integrating commissioners of finance to local governors was developed.

sen.j: 享保6年(1721年)に、「勝手方」（農政財政関係）と「公事方」（訴訟関係）というふたつの部門に分割された。
sen.e: In 1721, the kanjosho was divided into two departments of "kattekata" (in charge of agriculture and finance) and "kujikata" (in charge of lawsuits).
In 1721, the kanjosho was divided into two departments of "kattekata" (in charge of agriculture and finance) and "kujikata" (in charge of lawsuits).
In 1721, the kanjosho was divided into two departments of "kattekata" (in charge of agriculture and finance) and "kujikata" (in charge of lawsuits).
